paper.title: Deduction with Supernormal Defaults
paper.venue: Proceedings of the Second International Workshop on Nonmonotonic and Inductive Logic
paper.abstract: In this paper we consider supernormal defaults [Poo88] with a strict partial order defining their priorities [Bre91]. We investigate their relation to minimal or preferential entailment and show that the semantics given in [Bre91] has to be modified in order to be equivalent to a preferential model approach. Concering the multiple extension problem, we introduce the careful view as an alternative to the credulous and skeptical one, which is needed to handle the generalized closed world assumption [Min82] within this framework.
